reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Taawon for Conflict Resolution - Palestinian Women in Conflict Prevention and Peacebuilding - 14 months (1.9.2019-31.10.2020)

description.narrative: The project contributes to the FLC outcome: ?Women play a more meaningful role in conflict prevention mediation and peacebuilding.?. It aims to empower women champions to lead interventions and advocacy that ultimately increase their participation in nati onal efforts for civil peace and security. This will be achieved through building the capacities of women leaders in most conflict affected vulnerable communities in conflict analysis prevention and resolution. The project will establish Women-Led Conflic t Prevention Units at the Community Based Organizations/Community level to lead action. The units then carry out evidence-based awareness about the most prominent conflicts facing women in their localities and about the importance of their participation in action to resolve and prevent conflict. interventions in conflict transformation and mediation as well as steer public awareness and advocacy towards the importance of their participation in local and national efforts. The units along with surrounding sup portive constituencies will then lead advocacy and accountability activities to encourage duty bearers and women movements to localize the implementation of national plans on women peace and security (UNSCR 1325 NAP 2017-2019). The project will be implemen ted in 14 months duration in 2 localities in East Jerusalem (Hizma and Shufat) and 2 localities in Hebron (Yatta-village and old city-H2).The project has the following two results:Result 1: Increased awareness and capacity of local communities on local cha llenges and solutions to resolving violent conflicts.Result 2: Increased visibility of women participation in conflict resolution and prevention mediation and peacebuilding through social knowledge attitudes and practices for change in behaviors and so cial norms.

The project contributes to the FLC outcome: ?Women play a more meaningful role in conflict prevention mediation and peacebuilding.?. It aims to empower women champions to lead interventions and advocacy that ultimately increase their participation in nati onal efforts for civil peace and security. This will be achieved through building the capacities of women leaders in most conflict affected vulnerable communities in conflict analysis prevention and resolution. The project will establish Women-Led Conflic t Prevention Units at the Community Based Organizations/Community level to lead action. The units then carry out evidence-based awareness about the most prominent conflicts facing women in their localities and about the importance of their participation in action to resolve and prevent conflict. interventions in conflict transformation and mediation as well as steer public awareness and advocacy towards the importance of their participation in local and national efforts. The units along with surrounding sup portive constituencies will then lead advocacy and accountability activities to encourage duty bearers and women movements to localize the implementation of national plans on women peace and security (UNSCR 1325 NAP 2017-2019). The project will be implemen ted in 14 months duration in 2 localities in East Jerusalem (Hizma and Shufat) and 2 localities in Hebron (Yatta-village and old city-H2).The project has the following two results:Result 1: Increased awareness and capacity of local communities on local cha llenges and solutions to resolving violent conflicts.Result 2: Increased visibility of women participation in conflict resolution and prevention mediation and peacebuilding through social knowledge attitudes and practices for change in behaviors and so cial norms.
